Item Tooltip.Display: - Attacking with this item may heal you.
[DISARM] : Small chance to disarm attackers upon being struck.
- Sharp. Can <color=red>sever enemy limbs</color> more easily.
- Can <color=yellow>shock</color> enemies adjacent to your target.
<color=yellow>On Use</color>: Teleports you to the surface.
- Explosive: Damages enemies in a radius when thrown.
Disguises you as a member of the {0}.

Stats.Tooltip: Your Health. Once it hits 0, you die.
Your Stamina. It is used to perform special actions.
The amount of experience you have.
Increases physical melee damage and inventory carrying capacity.
Increases ranged/throwing damage and impacts Attack Delay slightly.
Impacts your ability to shrug off status effects.
Increases non-physical ability damage and effectiveness. Increases proficiency XP gain.
How often you hit with melee, ranged, and throwing weapons.
How easily you can move unnoticed.
Impacts shop prices, and some mental actions.
Decreases action points used during attacking actions.
The amount of items you can hold.
Determines how far you can see.

Display Radiation.Tooltip: The amount of radiation soaked into your body. This can cause mutations. You have none.
The amount of radiation soaked into your body. This can cause mutations. You have little.
The amount of radiation soaked into your body. This can cause mutations. You have a moderate level.
The amount of radiation soaked into your body. This can cause mutations. You have lots.
The amount of radiation soaked into your body. This can cause mutations. You have a large amount.

Proficiencies.Tooltip: Your skill with throwing weapons and items
Your skill with wielding random items as weapons.
Your familiarity with all armor types.
Your familiarity with shields. Increases your chance to block.
Your skill with carving up corpses.
Your ability to use throws and grips.

Status Effects.Tooltip: Poison: Deals damage every turn for its duration.
Bleeding: Deals damage every turn for its duration.
Flying: You are not affected by movement penalties in water.
Confused: Causes you to act in the wrong direction at random intervals.
Slowed: Reduces the move speed of your character.
Stunned: Causes you to miss turns for the duration.
Toppled: Prevents you from moving, and reduces your attack speed.
Haste: Increases the move speed of your character.
Regeneration: Heals you gradually over time.
Stuck: You cannot move for the duration of this effect.
Held: A creature has a grip on one of your limbs. Break out by moving away.
Unconscious: You cannot act during the duration of this effect.
Bracing: Your defense vs non-elemental attacks is doubled.
Drunk: You are intoxicated and have trouble walking straight. May cause vomiting.
Sick: You may vomit until this effect clears.
Overburdened: You are carrying more than you should. Speed is reduced.
Aflame: You will take damage every turn, unless doused with water or wait for flames to sputter out.
Off Balance: You are more susceptible to attacks that would move you around or trip you.
You cannot see. Attacking anything out of sight will be much less accurate.
You are frozen solid and cannot act until you warm up.
You are submerged under water.

Difficulties.Tooltip:
A more relaxed experience.

  - Death sends you back to your base. No items, money, or XP are taken away.
  - Reduced encounter rate.

A moderate difficulty.

  - Death sends you back to your base.
 - Upon death, 10% of your money is taken away, some items may be dropped, and you suffer minor stat and/or XP loss.

The way Axu was meant to be played.

  - Death is <color=red>final</color>, causing you to start from the beginning.
 -  Some substances may cause <color=red>addiction</color>.

A more challenging experience.

  - Death is <color=red>final</color>, causing you to start from the beginning.
  - More difficult enemies spawn earlier.
  - Some substances may cause <color=red>addiction</color>. (More likely than Rogue difficulty)
 - You are hunted by a mysterious group of assassins.

Titles.Display: Select a Limb to Attach to:

Misc.Display: You have so many followers already. I think I'll stay here until I'm needed.
The map was too worn to read. You threw it out.
The muscles in your arms are interwoven with synthetic materials, increasing their strength. (+2 STR)
You have small plates under the skin of this body part. They offer increased protection. (+1 Armor)
Your body slowly scrubs away radiation as your heart beats.
You have increased effective health. (+10 HP)
Your arm sports a curved blade that can be retracted into your flesh.
Your arm has a small firearm set above the wrist.
Your sole has an impact dampener, reducing sounds made by this leg. (+3 Stealth)
Upon being injured, your body will release nanomachines to help close the wound. (+HP Regen)
Your blood is filled with nanomachines that aid in removing fatigue from muscles. (+ST Regen)
Your eyes are able to accurately predict a target's movement. (+2 ACC)
Your achilles tendon is replaced by a stong, yet flexible material. (+SPD)

YesNo.Display: Are you sure you want to amputate your [INPUT]?
Do you wish to start as the [INPUT]?

<color=red>You have been ambushed by the Skull Bandits!</color>

You there! We have a proposition for you. <color=yellow>Give us $[INPUT]</color>, or <color=red>die</color>. What do you say to that fair trade? Limited time offer, friend.

<color=red>You have been ambushed by the Skull Bandits!</color>

You there! We have a proposition for you, friend. <color=yellow>Give us that [INPUT]</color>, or <color=red>die</color>. What do you say to that wonderous deal?
Would you like to save and exit the game?
Would you like to quit the game without saving?
Would you like to hire this mercenary for <color=yellow>$[INPUT]</color>?
This character is not hostile. Attack them anyway?
There is a book on the shelf here. Read a snippet?

Alerts.Message: You are [NAME], an exiled criminal sent to the planet Axu. After days of travel, your supplies are running dry. Luckily you have come across some sort of structure with <color=cyan>a man beckoning you</color> nearby. Is he a friend or foe? Further away from home than comprehension allows, will you attempt to find a way back to Earth, or come to terms with your exile?
A merchant beckons you over to peruse their wares!
You cannot equip this item since you do not meet its requirements.
The tome is too complex to comprehend! You become confused.
This container has no room left for any more liquid.
You have become addicted to this item! If you go without one for a period of time, you can suffer from withdrawals.
Defeated, you race back to a familiar location in hopes of staying alive. It seems you have bitten off more than you can chew this time.
You need a digging tool, like a Pickaxe, to interact with this object.

<color=grey>[You meet their demands]</color> 
Pleasure doing business with you. Go along your way, friend. Be sure not to come back around these parts, if you know what's good for you.

<color=grey>[You had nothing to give]</color> 
Nothing at all? I guess taking your life will suffice.
What an unforunate mistake. Get them, boys!
You were killed by: [NAME].
You have gained a reputation for devouring human flesh!
<color=white>[INPUT]</color>
<color=white>You have completed the quest "[NAME]". [INPUT]</color>
You have failed the quest "[NAME]".
Such a quaint little structure with nobody around. This would make for a suitable place to rest your head and use as a base of operations.
You don't have enough money to hire this individual.
Your party cannot support another mouth to feed.
They cannot hold any more!
You have no ammunition for this weapon.
You have nothing to throw
You can't amputate your head!
You are already on the surface, and don't need to use this item.
You cannot remove that item!
You have been ambushed! Flee or fight for your life!
You cannot travel with enemies in plain sight.
You cannot travel while starving!
You cannot rest while enemies are so close!
You have no hands to hold that item.
You don't have an extra hand to equip this item to.
You need two free hands to wield that weapon.
There is no more knowledge you can gain from this tome.
This item has no charges remaining.
There are no items that you can recharge!
Your stomach couldn't possibly take any more.
You have contracted Leprosy from eating infected meat!
You have contracted Leprosy from attaching an infected limb!
You have contracted Crystallization from attaching an infected limb!
You have contracted Crystallization from eating infected meat!
You have contracted Fledgling Vampirism from attaching an infected limb!
You have contracted Vampirism!
The door won't budge!
This ability is on cooldown. You can use it again in [INPUT] turns.
You don't have enough stamina to use this ability.
You cannot replace your only head!

Log.Display: Your movement is slowed from carrying so much.
You sent [NAME] back to the home base.
You crave a nice [NAME] right about now...
<color=red>Your brain deteriorates due to Brain Rot!</color>
You do not have the strength to wield the [NAME] in one hand. Attacks with it will be slower and easier to dodge.
Saira has a new hunt available.
There is a new challenge at the arena.
You break free of the web.
The tangled web holds you tight.
<color=magenta>The world seems more dark and sinister somehow...</color>
[DEFENDER]'s weapon is twisted out of their hands by [ATTACKER]!
[ATTACKER] strikes [DEFENDER]'s [BODY PART] with their [ITEM] for [DAMAGE] damage.
[ATTACKER] critically strikes [DEFENDER]'s [BODY PART] with their [ITEM] for [DAMAGE] damage!!
You are overcome by pangs of <color=orange>hunger</color>.
The [NAME] is removed with the severed part.
Your [NAME] has been refitted with the [ITEM].
You attach the [NAME] to your body. It responds to your commands almost instantly.
<color=red>[NAME]'s [ITEM] has been hewn from their body!</color>
<color=magenta>Your body changes. You now have the mutation "<color=yellow>[NAME]</color>".</color>
Your [NAME] feels more sturdy. <color=cyan>It has a crystaline sheen.</color>
You dig up the grave... You find treasures inside!
You dig up the grave... but find nothing of worth inside.
The map has been revealed to you.
The tome teaches you ancient secrets. You learn to use "[NAME]".
Your knowledge of the ability "[NAME]" has increased.
The [NAME] is removed with the severed part.
<color=yellow>The quest "[NAME]" has been added to your <color=cyan>journal</color>.</color>
<color=green>You turn the machine on. You hear the hum of engines resuming in the distance.</color>
<color=grey>You fiddle with the terminal. Nothing seems to happen.</color>
<color=red>Radiated material spews out of the cryopod!</color>
<color=red>The residual energy from the transport soaks into your body.</color>
Your skills have grown! You are now level [NAME].
The wind has kicked up a <color=maroon>sandstorm</color>.
You linked your current position with the device.
You teleport to the designated location.
You feel the radiation sickness subside.
<color=green>The shackle on your ankle breaks, and you feel more like yourself!</color>
The quest "<color=yellow>[NAME]</color>" has been updated. Open your journal for more information.
You cannot afford to pay for this service...
[ATTACKER] tries to shove [DEFENDER], but it fails.
[ATTACKER] tries to take [DEFENDER] down, but it fails.
[ATTACKER] presses on [DEFENDER]'s windpipe to no effect.
You have too many followers and cannot accept another.
<color=green>You insert the AI Core into the Robotic Frame. After a short bootup, the Hauler begins to follow you!</color>
This Hauler is currently offline. It seems to be missing something.

Help.Display: TIP: Once Vampirism has passed beyond the Fledgling state, you can no longer cure it. Seek a doctor before you become a creature of the night!
TIP: Mutations can be cured with a very rare liquid called Lunium. The selection of which to cure is random.
TIP: If one of your limbs gets severed, visit a doctor to reattach it, or buy a prosthetic. This can be a costly operation though.
TIP: Most diseases can be cured at a Doctor. Some may have positive effects that you won't want to get rid of.
TIP: Every three levels, you can aquire a new trait.
TIP: New abilities can be learned from Tomes. Some rare items may give you powerful abilities when equipped as well.
TIP: Living weapons gain increased effectiveness with use.
TIP: Mod Kits add special effects to a selected item. Only one can be applied at any time, so be careful when choosing!
TIP: You can coat your weapons in various liquids. The effects will be transferred to a target when they are struck.
TIP: If you find yourself on fire, you can pour liquids onto yourself to douse the flames.
TIP: Holding the Targeted Attack button (Default: Left Ctrl/Left Cmd) and pressing a movement key allows you to strike at a specific body part of an adjacent creature.
TIP: Holding The Grappling Attack button (Default: Left Alt) and pressing a movment key allows you to perform grappling moves on an adjacent target.
TIP: Enemies can follow you up or down stairs, and between screens. Be sure to keep your distance if you plan to flee.
TIP: Spending time in radioactive areas can cause you to mutate or get Radiation Sickness.
TIP: Attacks with your off-hand weapons will be triggered more often with higher Dexterity.
TIP: Digging tools like Shovels and Pickaxes have limited uses. Each time you dig through stone, it loses one point of durability.
TIP: You can store items in chests at your base by dropping them while standing on the same tile.
TIP: You can reorganize your abilities and items by pressing the Go Up/Down Stairs keys.
TIP: Ranged weapons are very useful for wearing down foes from far away. Throwing an item is also a viable option.
TIP: Walking through lava can be very dangerous. A high level of Heat Resistance is required to not take damage. Alternatively, you can fly over any pools of lava.
TIP: Vampirism can make you very powerful, but also stunt your growth. You will not be able to level up as a Vampire.
